				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/news-events" >CALENDAR &amp; EVENTS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/symposiums-conferences" >SYMPOSIUMS &amp; CONFERENCES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      2004: Dance, Drum &amp; Drink                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-137981" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="style_SkipStroke_2">
<div class="text-content Normal_External_625_53">
<div class="Normal">
<p class="paragraph_style"><strong>Dance, Drum, &amp; Drink</strong><br /><strong>Transposing Heritage through Expressive and Material Culture</strong></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="tinyText style_SkipStroke_3"></div>
<div class="style_SkipStroke_2">
<div class="text-content Normal_External_374_2381">
<div class="Normal">
<p class="paragraph_style_2"><span class="style">Friday, February 6 </span>&amp; Saturday February 7, 2004</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><strong><span class="style_1">Friday, February 6, 2004</span></strong><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2">5:30pm—7:30pm</span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2">5:30 - Welcome and Introduction (Deborah Foster)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_4"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><strong><span class="style_4">PERFORMANCES</span></strong><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2">5:45 - Kathak Dance (Sarah Morelli)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2">            Rangmanch<br />            Kramalaya in Kathak Yoga<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_4">Tapas and Beverages </span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2">6:30 - Rromani songs (Petra Gelbart)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2">            "Denas, more, denas" <br />            "Mre hurde chavore"<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2">6:45 - “Boston Jerk” (Hip-hop/Reggae) Wayne Marshall<br /><br />7:00 - "A Taste of WADaBo" <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">            Abdoulaye "Ablou" Diallo &amp; Members of the <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">            West African in Dance Boston Collective<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">            with "Timinandi" Drum Ensemble Directed by <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">            Moussa Traore. <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2"><br /></span><strong><span class="style_1">Saturday, February 7, 2004</span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></strong></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><strong><span class="style_3">10:00—4:00</span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></strong></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_4">PAPERS AND DISCUSSION</span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2">10:00 - Welcome Deborah Foster<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_4">Coffee and Muffins</span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2"> <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_4">FOOD PANEL</span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">10: 15 - “A Long Meal, a Short Trip, and a Sudden Switch: <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">            The Consumable Otherworld in Northern <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">            Europe” (Amber Rose)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2">10: 30 - “A Wine with Body” (C. Wibben-Meyer)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">10:45 - “African American Soul Food: from Scraps to <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">            World-famous Cuisine” (Lauren Hannah)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2">11:00 - Discussion<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_5">Discussant: Michael Herzfeld</span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2"> <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_4">Break: </span><span class="style_2">11:15-11:30<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_4">MUSIC PANEL </span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">11:30 - "Hip-hop in Jamaica, Reggae in Boston" <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">               (Wayne Marshall)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2"><br /><br />11:45 - “‘Authentic’ Folkloristics and ‘Assimilated’ Roma: <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2">            Cultural Invisibility and Social Image” (Petra Gelbart)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">12:00 - “‘Kathak Yoga’: Meditative Musicianship for an <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">            Indian Dance Form in the West” (Sarah Morelli)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2">12:15 - Discussion<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_5">Discussant: George Ruckert</span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2"> <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_4">LUNCH: </span><span class="style_2">12:30—1:30<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_4">Mediterranean and Provençal Fare</span><span class="style_2"><br /><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_4">DANCE/MOVEMENT PANEL </span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">1:30 - "Radiant Smiles: The International Spread of <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">            American Cheerleading." (Montana Miller)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">1:45 - “Paths of the Orishas: Ways of Knowing" <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">            (Anna Walters)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2"><br /><br />2:00 - “Dancing My Identity: A North American <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">            Embodiment of West African Dance" <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">            (Sharon Kivenko)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">2:15 - "Extending Aesthetics: Sepak Takraw as Folk Art <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">            and Sport" (Bill Westerman)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2">2:30 - Discussion<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_5">Discussant: Deborah Foster</span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_4">WINE, CHEESE, &amp; SONG:</span><span class="style_2"> 3:00-4:00</span></p>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1390600344' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-168531" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg">

          <h2 class="element-invisible"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/files/folklore/files/walters-symposium.jpg?m=1492187826">walters-symposium.jpg</a></h2>
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <img class="image-style-os-files-xxlarge" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xxlarge/public/folklore/files/walters-symposium.jpg?m=1499909549&amp;itok=fFAUKfi7" width="200" height="180" alt="" title="" />  </div>

  
</div>
</div></div></div>
  </div></div><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-48301"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/symposiums-conferences"  class="active-trail active"><span>Symposiums & Conferences</span></a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-182991"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/folklore-and-beyond-harvard-folklore-mythology-50" ><span>2017: Folklore and Mythology In and Beyond Harvard: F&M at 50</span></a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-142871"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/celebrating-another-harmony-south-asian-folklore-21st-century" ><span>2016: Celebrating Another Harmony: South Asian Folklore in the 21st Century</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-93471"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2015-netlore-globalizing-folklore-digital-world" ><span>2015: NETLORE: Globalizing Folklore in a Digital World</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48381"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2013-old-norse-mythology-its-comparative-contexts" ><span>2013: Old Norse Mythology in its Comparative Contexts</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48376"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2013-upside-down-inside-out-festivals-transgressive-performance" ><span>2013: Upside Down & Inside Out (Festivals as Transgressive Performance)</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48371"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2012-grimm-legacies" ><span>2012: Grimm Legacies</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48366"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2011-african-dance-diaspora" ><span>2011: African Dance Diaspora</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48356"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2010-singers-tales-21st-century" ><span>2010: Singers & Tales in the 21st Century</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48361"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2010-fire-mountain-bluegrass-symposium" ><span>2010: Fire on the Mountain: A Bluegrass Symposium</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48341"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2009-legends-landscape-narratives-nature" ><span>2009: Legends of Landscape, Narratives of Nature</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48336"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2008-folklore-nationalism" ><span>2008: Folklore & Nationalism</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48331"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2007-feminist-folklore-masculine-myths" ><span>2007: Feminist Folklore & Masculine Myths</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48326"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2006-performing-folklore" ><span>2006: Performing Folklore</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48311"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2004-dance-drum-drink"  class="active-trail active active"><span>2004: Dance, Drum & Drink</span></a></li><li class="last collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-170936"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2003-all-eyez-me-tupac-shakur-and-search-modern-folk-hero" ><span>2003: "All Eyez on Me: Tupac Shakur and the Search for the Modern Folk Hero"</span></a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>

		  <div class="branding-left"><a href="http://www.harvard.edu" ><img src="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/profiles/openscholar/themes/hwpi_basetheme/images/harvard-logo.png" width="235" height="32" alt="Harvard Logo" /></a></div><div class="branding-right"><a href="http://www.harvard.edu" >HARVARD.EDU</a></div>		</div>

<div id="page" class="container page os_pages-section-137976 header-left header-main content-top footer-left footer-right content-top-slideshow-enabled">
	<div id="page-wrapper">

		
					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/news-events" >CALENDAR &amp; EVENTS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/symposiums-conferences" >SYMPOSIUMS &amp; CONFERENCES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      2005: Folklore, Fantasy &amp; Film                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-137986" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="style_SkipStroke_2">
<div class="text-content Normal_External_625_42">
<div class="Normal">
<p class="paragraph_style">Folklore, Fantasy, &amp; Film</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="style_SkipStroke_2">
<div class="text-content Normal_External_374_1814">
<div class="Normal">
<p class="paragraph_style_1">Friday, February 11 </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_1">&amp; Saturday February 12, 2005</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_1"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3">Friday, February 11, 2005</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3">7:00 pm - 10:00 pm</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3">Thompson Room, Barker Center</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3">Short films, presentations, and refreshments</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2">Saturday, February 12, 2005</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">Thompson Room, Barker Center</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">BREAKFAST<br />9:30 am - 10:00 am</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">MORNING PANELS<br />10:00 am - 12:45pm</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">"Our Lady's Tumbler: from Medieval Fantasy to Modern </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">Fakelore" </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">(Jan Ziolkowski)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">"Seeking Seed-Wheat I Have Come: Desire between the </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">Worlds in Medieval Irish and Welsh Tales" </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">(Kate Chadbourne)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">"Why Should Sleeping Beauty Wake Up?" </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">(Cara Zimmerman)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">"Fairy Tale Romance: Love, Sex, and Bestiality Across the </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">Centuries" </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">(Catherine Orenstein)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">"The Magic Art of the Great Humbug: Performative </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">Language in The Wizard of Oz" </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">(Maria Tatar)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">LUNCH<br />12:45pm - 1:30pm</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">KEYNOTE ADDRESS<br />1:30pm - 2:30pm</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">James Russell<br />"J.R.R. Tolkien and C.S. Lewis: A Russian Liberal Perspective"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">AFTERNOON PANELS <br />2:30pm - 4:45 pm</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">"Tolkien and the Ornithography of Evil" </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">(Joseph Harris)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">"The Naming of Trees is a Difficult Matter: Treebeard </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">and the Kalevala" </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">(Veronica Heller)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">"The Mythological Heritage of Tolkien's Elves" </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">(Matthew Granoff)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">"Shared Narrative Framework in Role-Playing Games" </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">(Bryn Neuenschwander)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">"Star Wars: Myth and Autobiography" </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">(Paulette Curtis)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">"Imaginary Lands, Economic Territories: Conquering the </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">Global Film Market with the Fantasy/Sci-Fi Genre" </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">(Winnie Li)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">REFRESHMENTS<br />5:00 pm - 5:30pm</p>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>

											</div>
				</div>

				  <div class="region region-sidebar-first sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-48301"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/symposiums-conferences"  class="active-trail active"><span>Symposiums & Conferences</span></a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-182991"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/folklore-and-beyond-harvard-folklore-mythology-50" ><span>2017: Folklore and Mythology In and Beyond Harvard: F&M at 50</span></a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-142871"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/celebrating-another-harmony-south-asian-folklore-21st-century" ><span>2016: Celebrating Another Harmony: South Asian Folklore in the 21st Century</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-93471"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2015-netlore-globalizing-folklore-digital-world" ><span>2015: NETLORE: Globalizing Folklore in a Digital World</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48381"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2013-old-norse-mythology-its-comparative-contexts" ><span>2013: Old Norse Mythology in its Comparative Contexts</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48376"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2013-upside-down-inside-out-festivals-transgressive-performance" ><span>2013: Upside Down & Inside Out (Festivals as Transgressive Performance)</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48371"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2012-grimm-legacies" ><span>2012: Grimm Legacies</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48366"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2011-african-dance-diaspora" ><span>2011: African Dance Diaspora</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48356"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2010-singers-tales-21st-century" ><span>2010: Singers & Tales in the 21st Century</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48361"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2010-fire-mountain-bluegrass-symposium" ><span>2010: Fire on the Mountain: A Bluegrass Symposium</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48341"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2009-legends-landscape-narratives-nature" ><span>2009: Legends of Landscape, Narratives of Nature</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48336"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2008-folklore-nationalism" ><span>2008: Folklore & Nationalism</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48331"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2007-feminist-folklore-masculine-myths" ><span>2007: Feminist Folklore & Masculine Myths</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48326"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2006-performing-folklore" ><span>2006: Performing Folklore</span></a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-48311"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2005-folklore-fantasy-film"  class="active-trail active active"><span>2005: Folklore, Fantasy & Film</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48306"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2004-dance-drum-drink" ><span>2004: Dance, Drum & Drink</span></a></li><li class="last collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-170936"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2003-all-eyez-me-tupac-shakur-and-search-modern-folk-hero" ><span>2003: "All Eyez on Me: Tupac Shakur and the Search for the Modern Folk Hero"</span></a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>				  <!--sidebar first region end-->

					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/news-events" >CALENDAR &amp; EVENTS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/symposiums-conferences" >SYMPOSIUMS &amp; CONFERENCES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>

									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      2006: Performing Folklore                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-138026" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="style_SkipStroke_2">
<div class="text-content Normal_External_625_42">
<div class="Normal">
<p class="paragraph_style">Performing Folklore</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="tinyText style_SkipStroke_3"></div>
<div class="style_SkipStroke_2">
<div class="text-content Normal_External_374_2787">
<div class="Normal">
<p class="paragraph_style_1"><span class="style">Friday, February 10 <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_1"><span class="style">&amp; Saturday February 11, 2006</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_1"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_1">Friday, February 10, 2006<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">Thompson Room, Barker Center</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">5:00 pm - 6:00 pm</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">Keynote: Carl Lindahl (Univ. of Houston)<br /><br />"The Performance of Chaos &amp; the Drama of the Head"<br />(Narratives of New Orleans and Hurricane Katrina)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">6:15 pm - 7:00 pm<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">Buffet Dinner</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">7:00 pm - onward<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2">Performances</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6">Kate Chadbourne <span class="style_3">(Celtic Languages &amp; Literatures) </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">- Celtic ballad</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">Brendan Bulger <span class="style_3">(Folklore &amp; Mythology class of 1998)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">- Celtic fiddle</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">Harvard Pan-African Dance &amp; Music Ensemble</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_4"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_4"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"><span class="style">Saturday, February 11, 2006</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">Thompson Room, Barker Center</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5">9:30 am - 10:00 am<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5">COFFEE &amp; MUFFINS</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5">10:00 am - 11:00 am<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5">PERFORMING COMMUNITY</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_8"><span class="style_5"> <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">"Introduction"<span class="style_5"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">    (Lisa Brooks, <span class="style_3">Folklore &amp; Mythology, and History &amp; Literature</span>)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">"Peter Kalifornsky: Working Dena'ina Country with Words"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">    (Jenny Davis, <span class="style_3">'06 History &amp; Literature</span>)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">"The Experience of the Sacred in Louise Erdrich's Poetry"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">    (Merritt Baer, <span class="style_3">'06 Social Studies</span>)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">"His Stories Live: The Storytelling Work of Joseph Bruchac"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">    (Matthew Granoff, <span class="style_3">'07 Folklore &amp; Mythology</span>)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5">11:00 am - 11:30 am<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5">PERFORMANCE</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><br /><a href="http://www.hanksville.org/storytellers/savageau/" title="http://www.hanksville.org/storytellers/savageau/">Cheryl Savageau</a>, Abenaki storyteller</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5">11:30 am - 12:30 pm<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5">PERFORMING THE NATION</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_8"><span class="style_5"> <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">"Synge's Translations from Folklore to Stage"<span class="style_5"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">    (Aoife Spillane-Hinks, <span class="style_3">'06 Folklore &amp; Mythology</span>)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">"Performing the Folklore of Genealogy: Rituals of the </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">Chinese Nation"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">    (Michael Puett, <span class="style_3">East Asian Languages &amp; Civilizations</span>)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">"Lithic Legacies: Museums and Lithuanian National Identity"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">    (Katherine Olson, <span class="style_3">'06 Folklore &amp; Mythology</span>)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">"Cuckolds and Faithful Wives: The Genesis of the Gaelic Ballad of <span class="style_3">Peadar is Peigin</span>"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">    (Barbara Hillers, <span class="style_3">Celtic Languages &amp; Literatures</span>)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5">12:30pm - 1:30pm<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5">LUNCH<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5">1:30 pm - 2:30 pm<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5">PERFORMING RELIGION</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">"Voices of the ‘Azādār (mourner) in Iran and South Asia"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"> (Richard K. Wolf, <span class="style_3">Music</span>)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">"¡Abren Paso!: <span class="style_3">Orisha</span> Dance as a Symbolic System"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"> (Anna Walters, <span class="style_3">'06 Folklore &amp; Mythology</span>)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">"(En)Gendering Spiritual Power: Batá Performance in </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">Afro-Cuban Santería"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"> (Katherine Hagedorn, <span class="style_3">Pomona College</span>)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5">2:30 pm - 3:00 pm<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5">PERFORMANCE </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><br />Afro-Cuban Dance (<span class="style_3">Reynaldo Gonzalez &amp; Co.</span>)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5">3:00 pm - 4:00pm<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5">THEN WHAT, NOW WHAT?<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5"><br />(Folklore &amp; Mythology Alumnae)</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_10"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">"A Pretense of Performance: Film Production and the Manufactured Folk Narrative for the Mass Audience"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"> (Winnie Li, <span class="style_3">Folklore &amp; Mythology class of 2000</span>)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_8"><span class="style_5"> <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">"Flight Plans and Flight Paths: Tradition and Creativity in Trapeze Artist Careers"<span class="style_5"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"> (Montana Miller, <span class="style_3">Folklore &amp; Mythology class of 1996</span>)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">"Tashelhit Folk Tales for the World!"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"> (Hannah Sarvasy, <span class="style_3">Folklore &amp; Mythology class of 2003</span>)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9">"Storytelling in Multiple Media"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"> (Sara Berliner, <span class="style_3">Folklore &amp; Mythology class of 1998</span>)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_9"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5">4:00 pm - 5:00pm<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_5">WINE, CHEESE, &amp; WIND-DOWN</span></p>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div>  </div>

				  <div class="region region-sidebar-first sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-48301"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/symposiums-conferences"  class="active-trail active"><span>Symposiums & Conferences</span></a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-182991"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/folklore-and-beyond-harvard-folklore-mythology-50" ><span>2017: Folklore and Mythology In and Beyond Harvard: F&M at 50</span></a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-142871"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/celebrating-another-harmony-south-asian-folklore-21st-century" ><span>2016: Celebrating Another Harmony: South Asian Folklore in the 21st Century</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-93471"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2015-netlore-globalizing-folklore-digital-world" ><span>2015: NETLORE: Globalizing Folklore in a Digital World</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48381"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2013-old-norse-mythology-its-comparative-contexts" ><span>2013: Old Norse Mythology in its Comparative Contexts</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48376"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2013-upside-down-inside-out-festivals-transgressive-performance" ><span>2013: Upside Down & Inside Out (Festivals as Transgressive Performance)</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48371"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2012-grimm-legacies" ><span>2012: Grimm Legacies</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48366"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2011-african-dance-diaspora" ><span>2011: African Dance Diaspora</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48356"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2010-singers-tales-21st-century" ><span>2010: Singers & Tales in the 21st Century</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48361"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2010-fire-mountain-bluegrass-symposium" ><span>2010: Fire on the Mountain: A Bluegrass Symposium</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48341"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2009-legends-landscape-narratives-nature" ><span>2009: Legends of Landscape, Narratives of Nature</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48336"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2008-folklore-nationalism" ><span>2008: Folklore & Nationalism</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48331"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2007-feminist-folklore-masculine-myths" ><span>2007: Feminist Folklore & Masculine Myths</span></a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-48326"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2006-performing-folklore"  class="active-trail active active"><span>2006: Performing Folklore</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48311"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2005-folklore-fantasy-film" ><span>2005: Folklore, Fantasy & Film</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48306"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2004-dance-drum-drink" ><span>2004: Dance, Drum & Drink</span></a></li><li class="last collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-170936"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2003-all-eyez-me-tupac-shakur-and-search-modern-folk-hero" ><span>2003: "All Eyez on Me: Tupac Shakur and the Search for the Modern Folk Hero"</span></a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>				  <!--sidebar first region end-->
        
				
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">

					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" >The Committee on Degrees in Folklore &amp; Mythology</a></h1>
    <h2>Harvard University</h2>
    <p>
    <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/contact_owner" >Contact</a></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  <div class="region region-header-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-logo" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_logo no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_logo"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_logo' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" ><img src="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/files/folklore/files/greenman-red-sm2.jpg?m=1491626182" width="132" height="149" alt="The Committee on Degrees in Folklore &amp; Mythology" /></a></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  				 </div>

Calendar</span></a></li><li class="menu-7178 menu-path-node-137976   even   last  active-trail"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/symposiums-conferences"  title="" ><span>Resources</span></a></li><li class="menu-6814 menu-path-node-131546   odd   last "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/contact-0"  title=""><span>Contact</span></a></li></ul>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/news-events" >CALENDAR &amp; EVENTS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/symposiums-conferences" >SYMPOSIUMS &amp; CONFERENCES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      2007: Feminist Folklore &amp; Masculine Myths                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-138031" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="style_SkipStroke_2">
<div class="text-content Normal_External_625_42">
<div class="Normal">
<p class="paragraph_style">Feminist Folklore &amp; Masculine Myths</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="tinyText style_SkipStroke_3"></div>
<div class="style_SkipStroke_2">
<div class="text-content Normal_External_374_2875">
<div class="Normal">
<p class="paragraph_style_1"><span class="style">Friday, February 9 <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_1"><span class="style">&amp; Saturday February 10, 2007</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_1"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_1">Friday, February 9, 2007<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_2">Thompson Room, Barker Center<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_2"> <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_3">5:15 pm - 6:15 pm</span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_2">Keynote: Jo Radner &amp; Susan Lanser <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2">"Dropping Bobby Pins: Gender, Sexuality, <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_2">and Complicit Coding"<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_2"> <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_3">6:15 pm - 7:00 pm<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_3">Buffet Dinner</span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_2"> <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_3">7:00 pm - onward<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_3">Performances<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_2"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_2">Irish Music &amp; Dance<br />(Molly Hester '08, Max Newman '07, Cailin O'Connor '06)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_2">Scottish &amp; Breton Song<br />(Maggie Harrison F&amp;M '07 &amp; Matthieu Boyd, GSAS)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_2">Nordic folk music &amp; </span><span class="style_4">halling </span><span class="style_2">dance<br />(Amy Parker &amp; Scot Applegate)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_2">Blues<br />(Jess Tardy, F&amp;M '99)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_2">Georgian Folk Singing<br />(Iveria)</span><span class="style_5"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_6"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"><span class="style">Saturday, February 10, 2007</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6">Thompson Room, Barker Center</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"><span class="style_7">9:30 – 10:00 am – Coffee, muffins</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"><span class="style_7">10:00 am – PANEL ONE</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"><span class="style_7">Performance: </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">"Waulking the Cloth: Women's Work Songs from </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">Gaelic Scotland"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7"><br />(intro: Barbara Hillers &amp; Maggie Harrison)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"><span class="style_8"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"><span class="style_9">Women's Folklore in Ireland</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">"Màiri Nighean Alasdair: One Woman's Voice in Scottish </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">Gaelic Waulking Songs"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">    Maggie Harrison (F&amp;M '07) </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">"The Repertoire of Marc'harit Fulup (1837-1909)"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">    Matthieu Boyd (GSAS) </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">"Fairy Abduction in Legend and Life: Tales and Their </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">Function as Entertainment, Education, and Explanation"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">    Sarah Zeiser (GSAS)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">"Crossdressing in Scottish Balladry"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">    Grace Wilentz ('07)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"><span class="style_7">11:00 am – PANEL TWO</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">"Singing Life, Singing Myth: South Slavic Oral Poetry </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">in the Milman Parry Collection"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">    Aida Vidan,</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">"How to insult a giantess (and how to taunt Thor)" </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">(gender and insult in Old Norse)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">    Merrill Kaplan (F&amp;M '94)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">"Making Men in Myth from Táin Bó Cúailnge to Sin City"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">    Amber Rose (F&amp;M '04) </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">"Ká síijil t'an: Continuity and Regeneration in the </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">Contemporary Mayan Poetry of Briceida Cuevas Cob"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">    Rebecca Chase ('07) </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"><span class="style_7">12:00 pm – LUNCH</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"><span class="style_7">1:00pm – PANEL THREE</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">"Constructions of masculinity in men's fashion"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">    Louis Monoyudis (F&amp;M '98)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">"Superstars and Divas: Gender in the WWE"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">    Jonah Kanin (F&amp;M '08)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">"Baxter's Blunders, or, Corrective Narratives of Gender and </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">The Construction of Masculine Identity at South Kent </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">School"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7"> Marcel LaFlamme (F&amp;M '05) </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"><span class="style_7">1:45 pm – PERFORMANCE</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6">Marge Bruchac </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6">"Maligeet (the Abenaki doctress)" </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6">(intro: Lisa Brooks)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"><span class="style_7">2:30pm – PANEL FOUR</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">"From Lydia Pinkham to Michele Olson: Patent Medicine,</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">Blogging, and Black Cohosh"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">    Ana Vollmar ('08)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">"My Professor is a Penguin: Gender, Power and Beauty </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">in Second Life"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">    Rebecca Nesson (F&amp;M '98)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7">"The Wireless Wise Women of Urbanbaby.com"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_7"> Montana Miller (F&amp;M '96)</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_6"><span class="style_7">3:30 pm - WINE, CHEESE, &amp; WIND-DOWN</span></p>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-48301"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/symposiums-conferences"  class="active-trail active"><span>Symposiums & Conferences</span></a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-182991"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/folklore-and-beyond-harvard-folklore-mythology-50" ><span>2017: Folklore and Mythology In and Beyond Harvard: F&M at 50</span></a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-142871"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/celebrating-another-harmony-south-asian-folklore-21st-century" ><span>2016: Celebrating Another Harmony: South Asian Folklore in the 21st Century</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-93471"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2015-netlore-globalizing-folklore-digital-world" ><span>2015: NETLORE: Globalizing Folklore in a Digital World</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48381"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2013-old-norse-mythology-its-comparative-contexts" ><span>2013: Old Norse Mythology in its Comparative Contexts</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48376"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2013-upside-down-inside-out-festivals-transgressive-performance" ><span>2013: Upside Down & Inside Out (Festivals as Transgressive Performance)</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48371"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2012-grimm-legacies" ><span>2012: Grimm Legacies</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48366"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2011-african-dance-diaspora" ><span>2011: African Dance Diaspora</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48356"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2010-singers-tales-21st-century" ><span>2010: Singers & Tales in the 21st Century</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48361"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2010-fire-mountain-bluegrass-symposium" ><span>2010: Fire on the Mountain: A Bluegrass Symposium</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48341"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2009-legends-landscape-narratives-nature" ><span>2009: Legends of Landscape, Narratives of Nature</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48336"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2008-folklore-nationalism" ><span>2008: Folklore & Nationalism</span></a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-48331"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2007-feminist-folklore-masculine-myths"  class="active-trail active active"><span>2007: Feminist Folklore & Masculine Myths</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48326"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2006-performing-folklore" ><span>2006: Performing Folklore</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48311"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2005-folklore-fantasy-film" ><span>2005: Folklore, Fantasy & Film</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48306"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2004-dance-drum-drink" ><span>2004: Dance, Drum & Drink</span></a></li><li class="last collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-170936"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2003-all-eyez-me-tupac-shakur-and-search-modern-folk-hero" ><span>2003: "All Eyez on Me: Tupac Shakur and the Search for the Modern Folk Hero"</span></a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>

					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/news-events" >CALENDAR &amp; EVENTS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/symposiums-conferences" >SYMPOSIUMS &amp; CONFERENCES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>

									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      2008: Folklore &amp; Nationalism                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-138041" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="style_SkipStroke_2">
<div class="text-content Normal_External_625_42">
<div class="Normal">
<p class="paragraph_style">Folklore &amp; Nationalism</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="tinyText style_SkipStroke_3"></div>
<div class="style_SkipStroke_2">
<div class="text-content Normal_External_374_2467">
<div class="Normal">
<p class="paragraph_style_1"><span class="style">Friday, February 8 <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_1"><span class="style">&amp; Saturday February 9, 2008</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_1"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_1">Friday, February 8, 2008<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_2">Thompson Room, Barker Center<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_3">6:15<br />Gregorian Chant</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_3">6:20 <br />Welcome and Introduction - Stephen Mitchell</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_3">Performance</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">“Kaguramen” (Japanese mask dance) - <span class="style_4">Tomie Hahn<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_3">6:45<br />Buffet Dinner</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_3">7:15 <br />Performances</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">Scottish Song - <span class="style_4">Maggie Harrison</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">Cape Verdean Dance -<span class="style_4"> Carla Denny Martin</span> <br /><br />Sabar Drumming - <span class="style_4">Patty Tang<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_2"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"><span class="style">Saturday, February 9, 2008</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">Thompson Room, Barker Center</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_3">9:30 COFFEE &amp; BREAKFAST</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_3">9:50 <br />Opening Remarks (Stephen Mitchell)</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_3">10:00 PANEL ONE</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">“Genealogy as Folklore” <span class="style_4">(Sarah Burke)</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">“The South Will Rise Again? William T. Sherman and Confederate Nationalism, Past and Present” <span class="style_4">(Kelly Faircloth)</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">“Legends of Gregory the Great and the nationalist politics of the Gregorian Chant” <span class="style_4">(Jhosh Friedman)</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">“My School Rocks!” in India: Local Aesthetics and Adaptations Take the Stage as “High School Musical” Crosses Borders and Boundaries" <span class="style_4">(Montana Miller)</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><br /><span class="style_3">11:00 PANEL TWO</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">“For the sake of pleasing the Britons”: How Geoffrey of Monmouth Turned Common Folklore into National Legend" <span class="style_4">(Kaitlin Heller)</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">“Gáedel ocus Gall: Proto-nationalism in Early Medieval Ireland” <span class="style_4">(Brian Kennedy)</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">“Myth in the Making: The Repercussions of the Proposed </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">Highway through the Buried Landscape of Tara” </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="style_4">(Zenobie Garrett)</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">“Scottish Step Dancing in Nova Scotia” <span class="style_4">(Maggie Harrison)</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><br /><span class="style_3">12:00 LUNCH<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_3"><br />1:00 KEYNOTE</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">"Individualistic Obsessions: Folklore, the Nation-State, </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5">and the Invention of Europe."</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><br />Michael Herzfeld, Dept. of Anthropology</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><br /><span class="style_3">2:00 PANEL THREE</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">“Dancing the Nation: Global Trends in the Nationalization of Dance” <span class="style_4">(Sharon Kivenko)</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">“Becoming folk / lore of boundaries” <span class="style_4">(Tomie Hahn)</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">‘Villagers En Pointe: The Curious and Cheesy Tradition of National “Folk” Dances in Nineteenth-Century Grand Ballet"<span class="style_4">(Julie Buckler)</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><br /><span class="style_3">3:00 PANEL FOUR</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">“A Party for the Spirits: Transnational Vodou in Haiti and Boston” <span class="style_4">(Grete Viddal)</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">“Cape Verdean Music in Diaspora: Language, Nation, and Community” <span class="style_4">(Carla Martin)</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">“Drums and Dancing Lions: The Simb Tradition of Senegal”<span class="style_4">(Patty Tang)</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">“Folklore and Contested Nationalism, Whose Country Is It Anyway?” <span class="style_4">(David Guss)</span> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_3">4:00 WINE, CHEESE, &amp; WIND-DOWN</span></p>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-48301"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/symposiums-conferences"  class="active-trail active"><span>Symposiums & Conferences</span></a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-182991"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/folklore-and-beyond-harvard-folklore-mythology-50" ><span>2017: Folklore and Mythology In and Beyond Harvard: F&M at 50</span></a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-142871"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/celebrating-another-harmony-south-asian-folklore-21st-century" ><span>2016: Celebrating Another Harmony: South Asian Folklore in the 21st Century</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-93471"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2015-netlore-globalizing-folklore-digital-world" ><span>2015: NETLORE: Globalizing Folklore in a Digital World</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48381"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2013-old-norse-mythology-its-comparative-contexts" ><span>2013: Old Norse Mythology in its Comparative Contexts</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48376"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2013-upside-down-inside-out-festivals-transgressive-performance" ><span>2013: Upside Down & Inside Out (Festivals as Transgressive Performance)</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48371"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2012-grimm-legacies" ><span>2012: Grimm Legacies</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48366"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2011-african-dance-diaspora" ><span>2011: African Dance Diaspora</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48356"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2010-singers-tales-21st-century" ><span>2010: Singers & Tales in the 21st Century</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48361"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2010-fire-mountain-bluegrass-symposium" ><span>2010: Fire on the Mountain: A Bluegrass Symposium</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48341"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2009-legends-landscape-narratives-nature" ><span>2009: Legends of Landscape, Narratives of Nature</span></a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-48336"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2008-folklore-nationalism"  class="active-trail active active"><span>2008: Folklore & Nationalism</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48331"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2007-feminist-folklore-masculine-myths" ><span>2007: Feminist Folklore & Masculine Myths</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48326"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2006-performing-folklore" ><span>2006: Performing Folklore</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48311"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2005-folklore-fantasy-film" ><span>2005: Folklore, Fantasy & Film</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48306"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2004-dance-drum-drink" ><span>2004: Dance, Drum & Drink</span></a></li><li class="last collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-170936"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2003-all-eyez-me-tupac-shakur-and-search-modern-folk-hero" ><span>2003: "All Eyez on Me: Tupac Shakur and the Search for the Modern Folk Hero"</span></a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>				  <!--sidebar first region end-->

</div></div></div>
  </div></section><div id="block-boxes-1389395993" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1389395993"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1389395993' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>     </p></div></div></div>
  </div></div><div id="block-boxes-solr-search-box" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_search_solr_search_box no-title"  module="boxes" delta="solr_search_box"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/news-events" >CALENDAR &amp; EVENTS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/symposiums-conferences" >SYMPOSIUMS &amp; CONFERENCES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      2009: Legends of Landscape, Narratives of Nature                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-138046" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="style_SkipStroke_2">
<div class="text-content Normal_External_625_42">
<div class="Normal">
<p class="paragraph_style">Legends of Landscape, Narratives of Nature</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="tinyText style_SkipStroke_3"></div>
<div class="style_SkipStroke_2">
<div class="text-content Normal_External_374_2467">
<div class="Normal">
<p class="paragraph_style_1"><span class="style">Friday, February 13 <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_1"><span class="style">&amp; Saturday February 14, 2009</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_1"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_1">Friday, February 13, 2009<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_2">Thompson Room, Barker Center<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_3">5:30<br />Welcome and Introduction</span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_3">KEYNOTE:</span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_4">Kimberley Patton, </span><span class="style_2"><br />"'The Sea Can Wash Away All Evils': Iphigenia, Sedna, and the Submarine Mare as Myths of the Cleansing Ocean"<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_3"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_3">6:30                        <br />Buffet Dinner</span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_3"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_3">7:15                        <br />Performances</span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_4">Tomie Hahn</span><span class="style_2"><br />"Masquerading Jellyfish – fluid identities that matter"<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_4">John Bear Mitchell</span><span class="style_2"> <br />The Wind Bird <br />The Wabanaki's Mother – Dawn<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_4">Kate Chadbourne</span><span class="style_2"><br />Sea Songs<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_4">Anna Walters and Reynaldo Gonzales</span><span class="style_2"><br />Yemaya (Orisha dance - at right, images from their performance)</span><span class="style_5"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_6"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"><span class="style">Saturday, February 14, 2009</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4">Thompson Room, Barker Center</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_7">9:30                        <br />Coffee and Pastries</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_7"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_7">10:00                      <br />PANEL ONE</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_8">Nan Hutton, “</span>Revisiting the ‘Tree of Life’”<span class="style_8">     </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_8">Maria Cristina Vlassidis,</span> "Visions of Paradise in two Voices: The Significance of Trees, Plants, and Flowers in the Mesoamerican Cosmovision"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_8">Lisa Decesare,</span> “The Folklore of Carnivorous Plants”</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_7">11:00      <br />PANEL TWO</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_8">Coralynn Davis</span>, “Pond-Women Revelations: Gendered Knowledge and Sacred Geography in Maithil Women’s Expressive Forms”</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_8">Nimachia Hernandez</span>, "Naapi's Power, Play, and Place: Making Landscape and Niitsitapiiksi (Blackfoot)."</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_8">Julie Duncan</span>, “The Noachian Flood: For Many, More than Myth”</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_8">Marcel LaFlamme</span>, “Dreaming Lake Wobegon: nature, nostalgia, and the construction of an American 'folk'"</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_7">12:30     <br />LUNCH</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_7">1:30      <br />PANEL THREE</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_8">Kent Ryden,</span> “Toward an Ecofolkloristics”</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_8">David R. Foster</span>, “Reading, Conserving and Mythologizing the New England Landscape”</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_8">Ruth Olson, </span>“Struggling for Place: From “Protect the Earth” to “Making It Home”</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_8">Liz Carlisle,</span> “ Discourses of Nature: The View from Capitol Hill”</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_7">3:00      <br />PANEL FOUR</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_8">Amber Rose,</span> “The Dogs of Ancient Ireland”</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_8">John Dillon, </span>“Birds of a Feather: Figures of the Artist in Seamus Heaney's 'Sweeney Redivivus' and <span class="style_9">Buile Shuibhne”</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_8">Rachel Storch, </span>“The Solar Mythology of Kume Kunitake”</p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"> </p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_7">4:00 <br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_7">WINE, CHEESE, &amp; WIND-DOWN<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style"><span class="style_7"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style"><span class="style_7"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style"><span class="style_10">Image credits:</span><span class="style_7"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_2">(top) "Tree of Life: Guadalupe" by </span><a class="style_11" href="http://www.fas.harvard.edu/~folkmyth/www.PlainJaneStudio.com" title="http://www.fas.harvard.edu/~folkmyth/www.PlainJaneStudio.com">Jane LaFazio</a><span class="style_2"> (</span><span class="style_12">used with permission</span><span class="style_2">)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_10">Photos of Anna Walters and Reynaldo Gonzalez performing Orisha dances at the event (taken by Deborah Foster)</span></p>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>

								  <!--sidebar first region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-first sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-48301"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/symposiums-conferences"  class="active-trail active"><span>Symposiums & Conferences</span></a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-182991"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/folklore-and-beyond-harvard-folklore-mythology-50" ><span>2017: Folklore and Mythology In and Beyond Harvard: F&M at 50</span></a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-142871"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/celebrating-another-harmony-south-asian-folklore-21st-century" ><span>2016: Celebrating Another Harmony: South Asian Folklore in the 21st Century</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-93471"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2015-netlore-globalizing-folklore-digital-world" ><span>2015: NETLORE: Globalizing Folklore in a Digital World</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48381"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2013-old-norse-mythology-its-comparative-contexts" ><span>2013: Old Norse Mythology in its Comparative Contexts</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48376"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2013-upside-down-inside-out-festivals-transgressive-performance" ><span>2013: Upside Down & Inside Out (Festivals as Transgressive Performance)</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48371"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2012-grimm-legacies" ><span>2012: Grimm Legacies</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48366"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2011-african-dance-diaspora" ><span>2011: African Dance Diaspora</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48356"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2010-singers-tales-21st-century" ><span>2010: Singers & Tales in the 21st Century</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48361"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2010-fire-mountain-bluegrass-symposium" ><span>2010: Fire on the Mountain: A Bluegrass Symposium</span></a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-48341"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2009-legends-landscape-narratives-nature"  class="active-trail active active"><span>2009: Legends of Landscape, Narratives of Nature</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48336"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2008-folklore-nationalism" ><span>2008: Folklore & Nationalism</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48331"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2007-feminist-folklore-masculine-myths" ><span>2007: Feminist Folklore & Masculine Myths</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48326"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2006-performing-folklore" ><span>2006: Performing Folklore</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48311"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2005-folklore-fantasy-film" ><span>2005: Folklore, Fantasy & Film</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48306"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2004-dance-drum-drink" ><span>2004: Dance, Drum & Drink</span></a></li><li class="last collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-170936"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2003-all-eyez-me-tupac-shakur-and-search-modern-folk-hero" ><span>2003: "All Eyez on Me: Tupac Shakur and the Search for the Modern Folk Hero"</span></a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>				  <!--sidebar first region end-->

					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" >The Committee on Degrees in Folklore &amp; Mythology</a></h1>
    <h2>Harvard University</h2>
    <p>
    <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/contact_owner" >Contact</a></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  <div class="region region-header-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-logo" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_logo no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_logo"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_logo' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" ><img src="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/files/folklore/files/greenman-red-sm2.jpg?m=1491626182" width="132" height="149" alt="The Committee on Degrees in Folklore &amp; Mythology" /></a></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  				 </div>
			  </div>
		  </header>
      <!--header regions end-->
		
				  <!--main menu region beg-->
		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-900 menu-path-front  first   odd  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" ><span>HOME</span></a></li><li class="menu-6799 menuparent  menu-path-node-131471   even  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/about" ><span>About</span></a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-7191 menu-path-node-131471  first   odd  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/about" ><span>Intro to Folklore & Mythology</span></a></li><li class="menu-131425 menu-path-folkmythfasharvardedu-brief-history-folklore-and-mythology-harvard   even  "><a href="http://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/brief-history-folklore-and-mythology-harvard" ><span>Brief History of F&M</span></a></li><li class="menu-7189 menu-path-node-138251   odd  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/warren-house" ><span>Warren House</span></a></li><li class="menu-7190 menu-path-node-138256   even   last "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/art-credits-site"  title=""><span>Art Credits for Site</span></a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-6800
