	<div id="page-wrapper">

		
					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" >The Committee on Degrees in Folklore &amp; Mythology</a></h1>
    <h2>Harvard University</h2>
    <p>
    <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/contact_owner" >Contact</a></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  <div class="region region-header-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-logo" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_logo no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_logo"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_logo' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" ><img src="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/files/folklore/files/greenman-red-sm2.jpg?m=1491626182" width="132" height="149" alt="The Committee on Degrees in Folklore &amp; Mythology" /></a></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  				 </div>
			  </div>
		  </header>
      <!--header regions end-->
		
				  <!--main menu region beg-->
		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-900 menu-path-front  first   odd  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" ><span>HOME</span></a></li><li class="menu-6799 menuparent  menu-path-node-131471   even  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/about" ><span>About</span></a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-7191 menu-path-node-131471  first   odd  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/about" ><span>Intro to Folklore & Mythology</span></a></li><li class="menu-131425 menu-path-folkmythfasharvardedu-brief-history-folklore-and-mythology-harvard   even  "><a href="http://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/brief-history-folklore-and-mythology-harvard" ><span>Brief History of F&M</span></a></li><li class="menu-7189 menu-path-node-138251   odd  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/warren-house" ><span>Warren House</span></a></li><li class="menu-7190 menu-path-node-138256   even   last "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/art-credits-site"  title=""><span>Art Credits for Site</span></a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-6800 menuparent  menu-path-node-131481   odd  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/academics" ><span>Academics</span></a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-6821 menu-path-node-131601  first   odd  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/advising-0"  title=""><span>Advising</span></a></li><li class="menu-6977 menu-path-node-133586   even  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/academics/courses" ><span>Courses</span></a></li><li class="menu-7186 menu-path-node-138141   odd  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/concentration-requirements" ><span>Concentration Requirements</span></a></li><li class="menu-7187 menu-path-node-138206   even  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/secondary-field" ><span>Secondary Field</span></a></li><li class="menu-7188 menu-path-node-138246   odd   last "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/swapna-dev-memorial-book-prize" ><span>Swapna Dev Prize</span></a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-9174 menuparent  menu-path-people-taxonomy-term-13451   even  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/people/taxonomy/term/13451" ><span>People</span></a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-6826 menu-path-people-taxonomy-term-13446  first   odd  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/people/taxonomy/term/13446" ><span>Faculty</span></a></li><li class="menu-6827 menu-path-people-taxonomy-term-13451   even  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/people/taxonomy/term/13451" ><span>Standing Committee</span></a></li><li class="menu-6828 menu-path-people-taxonomy-term-13466   odd  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/people/taxonomy/term/13466" ><span>Staff</span></a></li><li class="menu-7192 menu-path-node-138271   even  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/concentrators" ><span>Concentrators</span></a></li><li class="menu-7193 menu-path-node-138276   odd   last "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/alumni"  title=""><span>Alumni</span></a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-6802 menuparent  menu-path-node-131491   odd  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/news-events"  title=""><span>Calendar & Events</span></a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-6825 menu-path-calendar  first   odd  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/calendar"  title=""><span>Current Calendar</span></a></li><li class="menu-7178 menu-path-node-137976   even   last  active-trail"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/symposiums-conferences"  title="" class="active"><span>Symposiums & Conferences</span></a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-6804 menu-path-node-131501   even  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/resources" ><span>Resources</span></a></li><li class="menu-6814 menu-path-node-131546   odd   last "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/contact-0"  title=""><span>Contact</span></a></li></ul>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/news-events" >CALENDAR &amp; EVENTS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/symposiums-conferences" >SYMPOSIUMS &amp; CONFERENCES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      2016: Celebrating Another Harmony: South Asian Folklore in the 21st Century                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-662851" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img height="288" width="384" style="display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-medium" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_medium/public/folklore/files/another-harmony-website3.jpg?m=1457734918&amp;itok=xbkvjWxw" alt="" title="" /></p>
<p>(Sponsored by: the Committee on Degrees in Folklore &amp; Mythology; the Office of the Provost; the Department of South Asian Studies; the Harvard University South Asia Institute; the Mahindra Humanities Center; the Committee on Degrees in Theater, Dance &amp; Media; and the Office for the Arts at Harvard.)</p>
<p>On Friday, April 8th and Saturday, April 9th, 2016, the annual Folklore &amp; Mythology Symposium will be "Celebrating <em>Another Harmony</em>: South Asian Folklore in the 21st Century"!</p>
<p>Please see this page for <a href="http://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/participant-titles-abstracts?admin_panel=1">Participant Titles &amp; Abstracts</a>.</p>
<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Friday, April 8, 2016</strong><br /><strong>Barker Center 133, Plimpton Room</strong><br /><strong>6:00 pm – 7:00 pm</strong></p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>Keynote</strong></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px">Margaret Mills, Ohio State University (Professor Emerita)<br /><em>"How Stories Lodge in Lives"</em></p>
<p>  </p>
<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Saturday, April 9, 2016</strong><br /><strong>Barker Center, Thompson Room</strong><br /><strong>9:00 am – 6:00 pm</strong></p>
<p> <strong>8:30 – Coffee &amp; Pastries</strong></p>
<p><strong> 9:00 – Opening Remarks</strong></p>
<p><strong> 9:15 – 10:45 – Undergraduate Student Panel</strong></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px">Aniket De, Tufts University<br /><em>“Divided Songs, Altered Gods: Partition, Nationalism, and Performance in the Bengal Borderland”</em></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px">Benjamin D. Grimm, Harvard University<br /><em>“Trans-gression: Gender, Divinity, and Cross-dressing in</em><em> the Krishna Līl<em>ā</em>hava”</em></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px"> Megan Taing, Harvard University<br /><em>“Brotherhood and Humor: Negotiating the South Asian American College Experience</em>”</p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>10:45 – 11:00 – Coffee Break</strong></p>
<p><strong>11: 00 – 12:30 – South Asian Folklore in Historical Perspective</strong></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px"><strong> </strong>Frank J. Korom, Boston University<br /><em>“Three Decades of Folklore Studies in South Asia</em>: <em>Toward a History”</em></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px"> Adheesh Sathaye, University of British Colombia<br /><em>“The Scribal Life of Folktales in Premodern India”</em></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px"> Leela Prasad, Duke University<br /><em>“Nameless in a Great Garden: When English Imperial Conquest Becomes a Purāṇa”</em></p>
<p><strong>12:30 – 1:30 – Lunch (provided)</strong></p>
<p><strong>1:30 – 3:30 – South Asian Material Culture &amp; Belief</strong></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px"> Joyce Burkhalter Flueckiger, Emory University<br /><em>“Standing in Cement: Ravana on the Chhattisgarhi Plains”</em></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px"> Kirin Narayan, Australian National University<br /><em>“Making and Narrating: Vishwakarma Family Stories among Artisans”</em></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px"> Puja Sahney, SUNY- Albany<br /><em>“Transnational Spaces of Belonging: Immigration Process, Social Ties, and Hindu Homes of Purity”</em></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px"></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px">Ülo Valk, University of Tartu<br />“<em>Where the Goddess Spent her Wedding Night: Place-Lore of the Kāmākhyā Temple in Silghat, Assam”</em></p>
<p><strong>3:30 – 3:45 – Coffee Break</strong></p>
<p><strong>3:45 – 5:15 – The Politics of Folklore</strong></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px">Leah Lowthorp, Harvard University<br /><em>“Folklore, Politics, and the State: Kutiyattam and National/Global Heritage in India”</em></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px">Shakthi Nataraj, University of California, Berkeley<br /><em>“Critical Folkloristics and the Study of Transgender Women’s Communities in South India”</em></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px"></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px">Finnian Gerety, Brown University<br /><em>“The Amplified Sacrifice: Sound, Technology, and Participation in Vedic Rituals in Kerala”</em></p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>5:15 – 5:45 – Closing Remarks and Discussion</strong></p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>5:45 – Performance </strong></p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>6:00 - End</strong></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p><em>(Cement image of Ravana (protagonist of the Ramayana) looking on as an effigy of himself is being burnt at the end of the Ramlila, Raipur, Chhattisgarh, October 2014.  Photo by Joyce Flueckiger.)</em></p>
<p></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

								  <!--sidebar first region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-first sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-182991"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/folklore-and-beyond-harvard-folklore-mythology-50" ><span>2017: Folklore and Mythology In and Beyond Harvard: F&M at 50</span></a></li><li class="expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-142871"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/celebrating-another-harmony-south-asian-folklore-21st-century"  class="active-trail active active"><span>2016: Celebrating Another Harmony: South Asian Folklore in the 21st Century</span></a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-142876"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/participant-titles-abstracts" ><span>Participant Titles & Abstracts</span></a></li></ul></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-93471"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2015-netlore-globalizing-folklore-digital-world" ><span>2015: NETLORE: Globalizing Folklore in a Digital World</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48381"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2013-old-norse-mythology-its-comparative-contexts" ><span>2013: Old Norse Mythology in its Comparative Contexts</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48376"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2013-upside-down-inside-out-festivals-transgressive-performance" ><span>2013: Upside Down & Inside Out (Festivals as Transgressive Performance)</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48371"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2012-grimm-legacies" ><span>2012: Grimm Legacies</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48366"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2011-african-dance-diaspora" ><span>2011: African Dance Diaspora</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48356"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2010-singers-tales-21st-century" ><span>2010: Singers & Tales in the 21st Century</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48361"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2010-fire-mountain-bluegrass-symposium" ><span>2010: Fire on the Mountain: A Bluegrass Symposium</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48341"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2009-legends-landscape-narratives-nature" ><span>2009: Legends of Landscape, Narratives of Nature</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48336"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2008-folklore-nationalism" ><span>2008: Folklore & Nationalism</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48331"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2007-feminist-folklore-masculine-myths" ><span>2007: Feminist Folklore & Masculine Myths</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48326"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2006-performing-folklore" ><span>2006: Performing Folklore</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48311"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2005-folklore-fantasy-film" ><span>2005: Folklore, Fantasy & Film</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48306"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2004-dance-drum-drink" ><span>2004: Dance, Drum & Drink</span></a></li><li class="last collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-170936"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/2003-all-eyez-me-tupac-shakur-and-search-modern-folk-hero" ><span>2003: "All Eyez on Me: Tupac Shakur and the Search for the Modern Folk Hero"</span></a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>

It may be more important to find someone who fulfills the roles that are essential to you than to have an adviser who is the leading light in his or her field. <meta property="og:description" content="An adviser can play a variety of roles in your work on the thesis. It may be more important to find someone who fulfills the roles that are essential to you than to have an adviser who is the leading light in his or her field. Among the roles an adviser can play are:" />

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/concentration-requirements" >CONCENTRATION REQUIREMENTS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/senior-theses-senior-projects" >SENIOR THESES &amp; SENIOR PROJECTS</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Choosing an Adviser                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-138221" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p class="paragraph_style_1"><span class="style_1">An adviser can play a variety of roles in your work on the thesis. It may be more important to find someone who fulfills the roles that are essential to you than to have an adviser who is the leading light in his or her field. Among the roles an adviser can play are:<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_1"></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px" class="paragraph_style_2"><strong><span class="style_3">The Expert:</span></strong><span class="style_1"> As an expert in your area, an adviser can be a tremendous resource. He or she can provide you with valuable bibliographic references and offer insight into how your topic fits in the larger body of scholarship. Also, your adviser’s intuition may allow you to discern which of your more unusual ideas are potentially productive.</span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px" class="paragraph_style_2"><strong><span class="style_3">The Taskmaster:</span></strong><span class="style_1"> Pacing your work is an important aspect of the thesis project. As well as observing official deadlines, you will have to set unofficial ones. An adviser who insists on setting and meeting strict deadlines can provide the necessary motivation for students who have a hard time keeping up.</span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px" class="paragraph_style_2"><strong><span class="style_3">The Editor:</span></strong><span class="style_1"> Some students prefer to have an adviser who is unobtrusive when it comes to deadlines and ideas, but is willing to spend considerable time on style and the mechanics of writing.</span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p style="padding-left:30px" class="paragraph_style_2"><strong><span class="style_3">The Critic:</span></strong><span class="style_1"> Your adviser can offer constant challenges to your ideas, in an attempt to encourage you to think through every detail of your argument. His or her critical perspective can help you to determine the extent of your progress.</span><span class="style_2"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"><span class="style_1">When you begin thinking about your topic, spend sometime talking with seniors who are writing theses. They will be able to give you an idea about what combination of roles their advisers fulfill. This information will be invaluable as you consider possible advisers. Once you have determined your chosen area of interest, consultations with faculty will enable you to refine your ideas and to initiate the search for an adviser. Your meetings with them will give you an opportunity to judge how well they might be able to respond to your plans and needs. If a faculty member appears interested in your project and seems to possess the combinations of skills you seek in adviser, simply ask if he or she is available.</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"><span style="font-size:large"><strong><span class="style_6">MANAGING THE PROJECT</span></strong></span><span class="style_5"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_7">The importance of organization in your work on the thesis cannot be overemphasized.</span><span class="style_8"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_7">Once you have an adviser, sit down with him or her and map out a timetable. Good long-range planning is vital in grappling with such a large project, especially since you are unlikely to have had any experience with a similar endeavor. Your own plans should include developing a good relationship with your adviser. As in any working relationship, communication is the key to productivity.</span><span class="style_8"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"><span class="style_7">Try to schedule regular meetings with your adviser and do all that you can to make them substantive. The frequency of your meetings will doubtless vary of the course of the semester. Most students meet more often with their advisers once they have begun writing.</span></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1389736423' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-163016" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg">

          <h2 class="element-invisible"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/files/folklore/files/mother-goose.jpg?m=1491647787">mother-goose.jpg</a></h2>
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <img class="image-style-os-files-xxlarge" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xxlarge/public/folklore/files/mother-goose.jpg?m=1499739154&amp;itok=pymWZj8a" width="200" height="179" alt="" title="" />  </div>

  
</div>

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/concentration-requirements" >CONCENTRATION REQUIREMENTS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/senior-theses-senior-projects" >SENIOR THESES &amp; SENIOR PROJECTS</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Choosing a Topic                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-138211" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p class="paragraph_style_1"><span class="style">A thesis topic must spring from your own energies and interests. The first step toward defining a topic, then, is to determine your primary areas of interest. The role of self-examination in this process is critical.<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_1"><span class="style_1"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"><span class="style">Look over your past work in the Folklore and Mythology program and your special field and attempt to discover a few general areas of interest. What courses have you taken? What have you written about in course papers? Also, think about why you decided to concentrate in Folklore and Mythology. As you consider these and other similar questions, you will begin to discern certain patterns or trends in your work. Contemplation of these issues will allow you to define your general areas of interest.</span><span class="style_1"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"><span class="style">Finding a topic within an area of interest is more difficult. A topic is best formulated as a question. But the questions cannot be too broad, for a topic must have focus. Nor can it be too narrow since the goal of a good thesis is to express thoughts of general importance through detailed analysis of a specific case or cases.</span><span class="style_1"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"><span class="style">Because the purpose of this process is to formulate a focused and thought-provoking question, the best way to uncover topics in your area of interest is to begin posing questions. Start with the issues that stand out in your mind. Also, read some scholarly literature on approaches you might take. If your topic seems too broad, this reading will give you some ideas on approaches you might take. If your question is too narrow, a selection of articles and books can lead you to the general concerns that relate to your interest. And remember, an undergraduate thesis need not be an original “contribution to knowledge.” More important is the sustained examination of a topic that engages you.</span><span class="style_1"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"><span class="style">If you are unsure about the viability of your topic, you might look at past theses in order to find out what types of projects have been the most successful. The best theses of each academic year are submitted to the Harvard University Archive, which is located on the first floor of Pusey Library. A list of selected honors theses from Folklore and Mythology is provided below, and many theses presented to the Committee are to be found in the Folklore and Mythology Library.<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="style_2"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_4"></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

								  <!--sidebar first region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-first sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1390598396" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_media no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1390598396"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1390598396' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-168491" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg">

          <h2 class="element-invisible"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/files/folklore/files/three-bears2.jpg?m=1492187822">three-bears2.jpg</a></h2>
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <img class="image-style-os-files-xxlarge" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xxlarge/public/folklore/files/three-bears2.jpg?m=1499734734&amp;itok=6o3cYGhN" width="200" height="180" alt="" title="" />  </div>

  
</div>
</div></div></div>
  </div></div><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/grants-research" ><span>Grants for Research</span></a></li></ul></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-48466"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/general-exams" ><span>General Exams</span></a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-48471"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/out-phase-concentrators" ><span>Out-of-Phase Concentrators</span></a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-48476"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/study-abroad" ><span>Study Abroad</span></a></li></ul></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48486"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/secondary-field" ><span>Secondary Field</span></a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48526"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/swapna-dev-memorial-book-prize" ><span>The Swapna Dev Memorial Book Prize</span></a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>				  <!--sidebar first region end-->
        
				
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">
		<!-- Three column 3x33 Gpanel -->
		
			<div class="at-panel gpanel panel-display footer clearfix">

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1389386751' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><span style="font-size:medium"><strong>FOLKLORE &amp; MYTHOLOGY</strong></span><br />Barker Center, 12 Quincy Street<br />Cambridge, MA  02138<br />617-495-4788</p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>								<div class="region region-footer-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1389388220" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html with-title"  module="boxes" delta="1389388220"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Concentration Requirements                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-138141" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="style_SkipStroke_2">
<div class="text-content Normal_External_625_1439">
<div class="Normal">
<ul><li><span class="Bullet">Concentration</span><span class="Bullet"> (14 half-courses)</span></li>
<li><span class="Bullet">Joint Concentration</span><span class="Bullet"> </span></li>
</ul><p class="paragraph_style_2"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_1"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"><span style="font-size:large"><strong><span class="Bullet">Concentration</span><span class="Bullet"> (14 half-courses)</span></strong></span><span class="Bullet"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"><span class="Bullet"><strong><span class="Bullet">I. Six required half-courses</span></strong></span><span class="Bullet"><br /></span></p>
<ul><li>CB 16. Performance, Traditions, and Cultural Studies: An Introduction to Folklore &amp; Mythology</li>
<li>FM 97. Fieldwork and Ethnography in Folklore </li>
<li>FM 98a. Oral Literature &amp; the Theory of Folklore Methodology</li>
<li>FM 98. Tutorial-Junior Year (one term)</li>
<li>FM 90 series (or approved seminar in folklore)</li>
</ul><p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="Bullet">Option A: FM 99. Tutorial-Senior Year (two terms)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="Bullet">Option B: FM 96r. Non-Thesis Tutorial (1 term, repeatable)<br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="Bullet"><span class="Bullet"><strong>II. Two half-courses outside of the student’s Special Field that are either Folklore and Mythology courses or courses cross-listed with Folklore and Mythology.</strong> </span><br /><br />(These courses must be approved by the Head Tutor.)</span><span class="Bullet"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="Bullet"><span class="Bullet"><strong>III. Five half-courses in the student’s chosen Special Field approved by the Committee.</strong></span><br /><br /><strong>IV. Language Study:</strong> Proficiency in a language other than English, equivalent to that ordinarily required by two years of college study, is highly recommended. Up to three courses of language may, in individual cases, and with the approval of the Head Tutor, and in consultation with an adviser in the relevant Special Field, be counted toward concentration.</span><span class="Bullet"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="Bullet">The specifics of the language study should be discussed at an early stage with the Head Tutor.</span><span class="Bullet"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="Bullet">[For information on the College Language Requirement and the possibility of receiving a Language Citation from the College for advanced foreign language work, see the Handbook for Students.]</span><span class="Bullet"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><strong><span class="Bullet">V. Senior Honors Thesis (or Non-Thesis capstone option.</span></strong></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><strong><span class="Bullet"></span><span class="Bullet">VI.</span><span class="Bullet"></span></strong><span class="Bullet"><strong>General Exam:</strong> Three-hour written examination on Folklore and Mythology, and a one-hour oral exam on the Special Field.</span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="Bullet"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span style="font-size:large"><strong><span style="font-size:large">Joint Concentration </span></strong></span><span style="font-size:large"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_2"><strong><span class="Bullet">I. Four required half-courses</span></strong><span class="Bullet"><br /></span></p>
<ul><li>CB 16. Performance, Traditions, and Cultural Studies: An Introduction to Folklore &amp; Mythology</li>
<li>FM 97. Fieldwork and Ethnography in Folklore </li>
<li>FM 98a. Oral Literature &amp; the Theory of Folklore Methodology</li>
<li>FM 98b. Junior tutorial (may be taken in the Primary Field)</li>
<li>FM 90 seminar.</li>
</ul><p class="paragraph_style_3"><strong><span class="Bullet">II. Two related Folklore and Mythology courses approved by the Head Tutor.</span></strong><span class="Bullet"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><strong><span class="Bullet">III. Senior Honors Thesis (two terms of 99 in the Primary Field, topic approved by the Head Tutors of both fields).</span><span class="Bullet"><br /></span></strong></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><strong><span class="Bullet">IV. Written General Exam in Folklore and Mythology</span></strong><span class="Bullet"><br /></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_5"><span class="Bullet"><span> </span></span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="Bullet"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="Bullet"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="Bullet"> </span></p>
<p class="paragraph_style_3"><span class="Bullet"> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="spacer"> </div></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1390597192' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-168426" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg">

          <h2 class="element-invisible"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/files/folklore/files/navajo-rug.jpg?m=1492187782">navajo-rug.jpg</a></h2>
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <img class="image-style-os-files-xxlarge" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xxlarge/public/folklore/files/navajo-rug.jpg?m=1499734891&amp;itok=chbhICgZ" width="200" height="180" alt="" title="" />  </div>

  
</div>
</div></div></div>
  </div></div><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail <div id="page" class="container page header-left header-main content-top footer-left footer-right content-top-slideshow-enabled">
	<div id="page-wrapper">

		
					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" >The Committee on Degrees in Folklore &amp; Mythology</a></h1>
    <h2>Harvard University</h2>
    <p>
    <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/contact_owner" >Contact</a></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  <div class="region region-header-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-logo" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_logo no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_logo"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_logo' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" ><img src="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/files/folklore/files/greenman-red-sm2.jpg?m=1491626182" width="132" height="149" alt="The Committee on Degrees in Folklore &amp; Mythology" /></a></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  				 </div>
			  </div>
		  </header>
      <!--header regions end-->
		
				  <!--main menu region beg-->
		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-900 menu-path-front  first   odd  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" ><span>Brief History of F&M</span></a></li><li class="menu-7189 menu-path-node-138251   odd  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/warren-house" ><span>Warren House</span></a></li><li href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/secondary-field" ><span>Secondary Field</span></a></li><li class="menu-7188 menu-path-node-138246   odd   last "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/swapna-dev-memorial-book-prize" ><span>Swapna Dev Prize</span></a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-9174 menuparent  menu-path-people-taxonomy-term-13451   even  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/people/taxonomy/term/13451" ><span>People</span></a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-6826 menu-path-people-taxonomy-term-13446  first   odd  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/people/taxonomy/term/13446" ><span>Faculty</span></a></li><li class="menu-6827 menu-path-people-taxonomy-term-13451   even  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/people/taxonomy/term/13451" ><span>Standing Committee</span></a></li><li class="menu-6828 menu-path-people-taxonomy-term-13466   odd  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/people/taxonomy/term/13466" ><span>Staff</span></a></li><li class="menu-7192 menu-path-node-138271   even  "><a   </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/people/taxonomy/term/13451" >PEOPLE</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Concentrators                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-138271" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p class="paragraph_style_5"> </p><table border="0" style="width:431px; height:224px"><tr><td>Natalie Chew ('17)</td><td> </td><td> </td><td><p>Daniel Hellstrom ('18)</p></td><td> </td></tr><tr><td>Emma Cobb ('17) </td><td> </td><td> </td><td>Ailie Kerr ('18)</td><td> </td></tr><tr><td><span>Monica Marion ('17)</span></td><td> </td><td> </td><td>Kareli Osorio ('18)</td><td> </td></tr><tr><td><span>Maggie Vo ('17)</span></td><td> </td><td> </td><td>Jose Perez ('18)</td><td> </td></tr><tr><td><span> </span></td><td> </td><td> </td><td>Megan Sims ('18)</td><td> </td></tr><tr><td><span> </span></td><td> </td><td> </td><td>Emily Zauzmer ('18)</td><td> </td></tr></table><p class="paragraph_style_1"> </p><p class="paragraph_style_1"> </p><p class="paragraph_style_1"> </p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

								  <!--sidebar first region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-first sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1390597690" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_media no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1390597690"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1390597690' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-168486" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg">

          <h2 class="element-invisible"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/files/folklore/files/southwest-pottery.jpg?m=1492187814">southwest-pottery.jpg</a></h2>
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <img class="image-style-os-files-xxlarge" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xxlarge/public/folklore/files/southwest-pottery.jpg?m=1499746070&amp;itok=W9q9NZAN" width="200" height="180" alt="" title="" />  </div>

  
</div>
</div></div></div>
  </div></div><div id="block-boxes-1389393944" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_taxonomy_fbt navigation no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1389393944"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1389393944' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div class="item-list"><ul><li class="term-chair"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/people/chair"  class="" title="">Chair</a></li><li class="term-head-tutor"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/people/head-tutor"  class="" title="">Head Tutor</a></li><li class="term-faculty"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/people/faculty"  class="" title="">Faculty</a></li><li class="term-standing-committee"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/people/standing"  class="" title="">Standing Committee</a></li><li class="term-affiliated-committee"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/people/affiliate"  class="" title="">Affiliated Committee</a></li><li class="term-associates"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/people/associate"  class="" title="">Associates</a></li><li class="term-emeritus"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/people/emeritus"  class="" title="">Emeritus</a></li><li class="term-staff"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/people/staff"  class="" title="">Staff</a></li></ul></div></div></div></div>

					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" >The Committee on Degrees in Folklore &amp; Mythology</a></h1>
    <h2>Harvard University</h2>
    <p>
    <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/contact_owner" >Contact</a></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  <div class="region region-header-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-logo" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_logo no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_logo"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_logo' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" ><img src="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/files/folklore/files/greenman-red-sm2.jpg?m=1491626182" width="132" height="149" alt="The Committee on Degrees in Folklore &amp; Mythology" /></a></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  				 </div>
			  </div>
		  </header>
      <!--header regions end-->
		
				  <!--main menu region beg-->
		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-900 menu-path-front  first   odd  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" ><span>HOME</span></a></li><li class="menu-6799 menuparent  menu-path-node-131471   even  "><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/about" ><span>About</span></a><span                     <h1 id="page-title">
                      Contact                    </h1>
                </header>

<p>
	Holly Hutchison<br /><em>Department Administrator</em><br />Warren House 101<br />617-495-4788<br /><a href="mailto:hhutchis@fas.harvard.edu">hhutchis@fas.harvard.edu</a>

					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												Contact Site Owner											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">

					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" >The Committee on Degrees in Folklore &amp; Mythology</a></h1>
    <h2>Harvard University</h2>
    <p>
    <a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/contact_owner" >Contact</a></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  <div class="region region-header-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-logo" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_logo no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_logo"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_logo' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><a href="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/" ><img src="https://folkmyth.fas.harvard.edu/files/folklore/files/greenman-red-sm2.jpg?m=1491626182" width="132" height="149" alt="The Committee on Degrees in Folklore &amp; Mythology" /></a></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  				 </div>
